physical_appearance:This is a portrait photograph. It features a man
 dressed in a shirt
 pants and tie
 sitting in a foldable lounge chair on a grassy land. Behind him
 there is a fence
 with a tall field of grass behind it. There are several small rooftops seen in the background. The man is smoking a cigarette. There are no inscriptions on the photograph.

sgcool_label_text:Loose papers from the James Steele
 P.O.W archive that include a symbolic drawing
 Japanese banana money
 map of camp
 administrative papers from Changi prison pre-dating internment
 list of soldiers of a regiment as well as James Steele’s warrant to  join the army. These papers are part of the archive of James Steele
 Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942
 when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.

metadata.title_text: Miscellaneous scraps of paper from P.O.W James Steele Archives (30 pieces) P.O.W. James Steele Archives: Portrait photograph
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a portrait photograph. It features a man, dressed in a shirt, pants and tie, sitting in a foldable lounge chair on a grassy land. Behind him, there is a fence, with a tall field of grass behind it. There are several small rooftops seen in the background. The man is smoking a cigarette. There are no inscriptions on the photograph.
metadata.subject_terms_1: world wars prisoners of war documents (object genre) portraits
metadata.subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Prisoners of war Portrait photography
metadata.context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
metadata.sgcool_label_text: Loose papers from the James Steele, P.O.W archive that include a symbolic drawing, Japanese banana money, map of camp, administrative papers from Changi prison pre-dating internment, list of soldiers of a regiment as well as James Steele’s warrant to  join the army. These papers are part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
